title: Volunteers Adding Life in Dementia (VALID)
description_brief: The objectives of our project are to: 1.) Develop a training program and manual for volunteers to implement evidence-based, non-pharmacological interventions for neuropsychiatric symptoms (NPS) of dementia in long-term care (LTC) settings; 2.) Recruit and train volunteers using the VALID program and pilot test the volunteer-led program with 20 individuals with Alzheimer's disease and NPS in a LTC facility in Kingston; and, 3.) Evaluate the effects of the VALID program on the symptoms of NPS, patient quality of life, volunteer's experience, and LTC staff stress.
explanation_target: Reason: The trial describes a volunteer-led, evidence-based, non-pharmacological program (VALID) designed specifically to reduce neuropsychiatric symptoms (NPS) of dementia in long-term care and to improve patient quality of life and staff outcomes — i.e., the intervention targets behavioral/psychiatric symptoms rather than disease pathology or cognition directly. citeturn0search1turn0search8
